intro: Bomarea evecta, commonly known as the pink bomarea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Alstroemeriaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant produces clusters of small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer.
